description: From Latin sexāgēnārius (“sixty; sixty years old; a sixty-year-old”) either directly or via French sexagénaire, from Latin sexāgēnī (“60 each”), from sexaginta (“six tens, sixty”). Cognate with sexagenarian.

definitionGroups.group: Of or related to the number sixty, particularly:

examples: The sexagenary cycle is formed by combining the twelve earthly branches representing the years of Jupiter's orbital cycle and the ten heavenly stems of the Shang-era week, stopping halfway through to reflect the pairing of yin and yang terms.

entries.meaning: (now rare) Synonym of sexagenarian: lasting or aged sixty years; sixty-year-old.
(mathematics, astronomy, now rare) Synonym of sexagesimal: base-60.
(mathematics, astronomy, now rare) Synonym of sexagesimal: base-60 numeration.
(now rare) Synonym of sexagenarian: a sixty-year-old.
